list_definition.definition: a farm, especially one in North America for rearing cattle or horses

list_ex_of_english: These include commercial maize production, horticulture, tree crops, dairy, and cattle ranching.
Logging generally is the initial mode of land development, followed by land clearing, cropping, and cattle ranching.
They are labeled as 'costs' due to the prevailing notion that ranching leads to negative environmental impacts.
Commercial livestock ranching systems (which replaced the wild herds and are barely a hundred years old) produce meat, hides and fiber.
But the development of individual ranches raised several concerns.
In-terms of vegetation, 80 per cent of the district can be classified as low savanna and arid/semi-arid (ranching zones).
